lines.text:
[opens the door]
Oh, I was expecting a friend.
Why am I making excuses for him? He certainly never bothered to for himself.
I'm going to Eton later on.
Eton's no joking matter old cock. Half the war cabinet came from there.
Well they won the war for us, didn't they.

No. I'll tell you who's done that for you, if you like. Me. And 'im. The common fighting man. The most long-suffering bloomin' animal in 'uman creation. Forgotten in peacetime. A 'uman target in wartime. And bewitched and bewildered all the time.
Vivian's obviously not fit for civilised society - can't you get him into the City, Robert?
He's in the lounge with your aunt.
Not the fatted calf, I'm afraid.
Good old Viv. He died as he lived - drinking champagne he never paid for.
I've nothing against you personally Kenway.
Decent of you to say so.

It just that you're the last straw that's all. I'm sick and tired of teaching their jobs to gilded youths backed by influence and class privilege, and then watching them end up with better positions than my own.
